greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Array read by antidiagonals: a(n,k)= coefficient of z^n of p_k(z), where p_k+1(z)=(p_k(z))^2+z, p_1(z)=z.
comment: a(n,k+1)=a(n,k), n<=k; a(n,n)=A000108. Note that the set {z: limit(p_k(z),k->infinity) not=infinity} of complex numbers defines the Mandelbrot set.
link: R. P. Munafo, Mu-Ency - The Encyclopedia of the Mandelbrot Set
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Mandelbrot Set
R. Munafo, Coefficients of Lemniscates for Mandelbrot Set
mathematica: p[1, z_] := z; p[k_, z_] := p[k, z] = p[k-1, z]^2 + z; a[n_, k_] := Coefficient[p[k, z], z, n]; Flatten[ Table[a[n-k, k], {n, 1, 13}, {k, n-1, 1, -1}]] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jun 13 2012 *)
xref: Cf. A137560, which gives the same array read by rows. [From _Robert Munafo_, Dec 12 2009]
results.author: Klaus Strassburger (strass(AT)ddfi.uni-duesseldorf.de), Jan 24 2000
